article_title: Cheer Up, Obama’s Legacy Can Be Erased
article_text: President Obama seems to aspire to join Franklin Roosevelt and Ronald Reagan as one of the three most transformative presidents of the past hundred years, and by all outward signs he has achieved that goal. But while Roosevelt and Reagan sold their programs to the American people and enacted them with bipartisan support, Mr. Obama jammed his partisan agenda down the public’s throat. The Obama legacy is built on executive orders, regulations and agency actions that can be overturned using the same authority Mr. Obama employed to...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Phil Gramm and Michael Solon write that President Obama rammed through an agenda that could be quickly undone by a Republican president.
twitter.title: Cheer Up, Obama’s Legacy Can Be Erased

image.alt: Cheer Up, Obama’s Legacy Can Be Erased

article_metadata.article.origheadline: Cheer Up, Obama’s Legacy Can Be Erased

article_summary:
The Obama legacy is built on executive orders, regulations and agency actions that can be overturned using the same authority Mr. Obama employed to...
But while Roosevelt and Reagan sold their programs to the American people and enacted them with bipartisan support, Mr. Obama jammed his partisan agenda down the public’s throat.
President Obama seems to aspire to join Franklin Roosevelt and Ronald Reagan as one of the three most transformative presidents of the past hundred years, and by all outward signs he has achieved that goal.
